articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces advanced deeper into some towns on the eastern side of Khan Younis in southern Gaza on Thursday, hours after Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu told U.S. lawmakers he was actively engaged in bringing hostages home.
articles.title: Israeli forces advance in southern Gaza, tanks active in Rafah

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Typhoon Gaemi blew through northern Taiwan on Thursday, killing two people, bringing floods and leading to traffic snarls, before heading across the sea and into China where it is expected to bring further torrential rain.
articles.title: Typhoon Gaemi barrels through Taiwan, killing two, heads to Chinese coast

articles.author: Phil Stewart, Idrees Ali
articles.description: The first time President Joe Biden's administration considered ordering the U.S. military to build a floating pier off Gaza to deliver aid in late 2023, it was put on the backburner.
articles.title: How Biden’s Gaza pier project unraveled

articles.author: Layli Foroudi, Juliette Jabkhiro
articles.description: French paramedic Seifelislam Benadda had just dropped off a patient at hospital on July 1, he said, when police informed him he was prohibited from leaving his hometown in the Paris suburbs, saying he was a potential threat to the Olympic Games.
articles.title: Paris Olympics security sweep upends lives, courts overturn cases

articles.author: James Oliphant, Steve Holland
articles.description: President Joe Biden on Wednesday addressed the nation for the first time since dropping his reelection bid, saying he decided to forgo personal ambition to save democracy in a sedate Oval Office speech that contrasted with the rough-and-tumble campaign.
articles.title: With Biden out, Trump and Harris exchange barbs in reset US presidential race

articles.author: Vivian Sequera, Tibisay Romero
articles.description: Sunday's presidential election in Venezuela has attracted a level of voter enthusiasm not seen in at least a decade.
articles.title: In Venezuela, disillusioned former socialists now back the opposition

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A prominent activist jailed and made famous over his public call for reforms to Thailand's powerful monarchy was given four more years in prison for another violation of the country's royal insults law, a legal aid group said on Thursday.
articles.title: Thai activist who called for monarchy reform gets 4 more years in jail

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Relatives of the 18 dead in an airplane crash in Nepal have yet to hear from the government or the airline on the possible cause of the disaster, they said a day after the small jet went down during take-off at the airport in Kathmandu, the capital.
articles.title: Relatives of 18 dead in Nepal plane crash demand answers

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The death toll from landslides in Ethiopia earlier this week has risen to 257, and is expected to rise to 500, United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs said on Thursday.
articles.title: Death toll from Ethiopia landslides could rise to 500, UN says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Frankfurt airport, Germany's busiest, temporarily suspended flights on Thursday morning after several climate activists blocked runways by gluing themselves to the tarmac.
articles.title: Frankfurt airport halts flights as climate activists block runway
